abstract: Bank of America and Countrywide Financial have held discussions about an “alliance” that could eventually lead to an acquisition of Countrywide by Bank of America, The Financial Times reported Friday afternoon, citing unnamed sources. Such a deal would create the biggest mortgage lending group in the United States, joining Bank of America’s size and Countrywide’s significant lending business. Analysts said a Countrywide buyout could cost BofA about $30 billion.
